text: You’ll need to know HubL - some tags or functions to pull in the blog posts, and the basics about modules (fields.json etc)

<@UQERM7BLY> The blog stuff is a bit different than modules and templates. You’ll need to create a listing template (this is for your home, author listing, and tag listing pages) and a post template( for a blog post)
These are then auto filled with content from your blog DB

If you want a module on your blogs with custom content, say a featured section of posts, or something else where the content editor can manually update the content, you’ll need to use global modules and edit the content from there

its a pain in the ass, but because there is no way to “edit” the blog home page, you have to go the workaround way with a global module. I do know that they are working on overhauling the blog functionality in the CMS because of these limitations
and adding custom modules to blog templates might be a thing in the future
Indeed, that would be nice! I misread the comment and thought that he may have wanted to create a module which lists the blog posts :smile:
